name: Empathise
moreInfo: Gain deep insight into users' needs and motivations.
tasks: Talk to at least 3 target users

name: Define
info: "Focus your chaos into a clear challenge"
moreInfo: Transform your research into a concise problem statement.
tasks: [User] experiences [problem] when they [action] in [this context]. This is a problem because [impact on the user]

name: Ideate
moreInfo: Generate a broad range of potential solutions without judgment
tasks: Make sure you encourage big and wild ideas. Use “Yes, and…” to expand ideas building on teammates' suggestions.
Don't forget to vote on top 3 concepts and refine chosen ideas only!

name: Prototype
moreInfo: Create a tangible representation to test core assumptions
tasks: Pick the fastest tool, using paper or click‑through mocks

name: Test
moreInfo: Gather user input to validate and refine your prototype.
tasks: Share early and often to iterate on feedback
Test with real users and ask them to think aloud

name: Submission
moreInfo: Finalise deliverables and ensure compliance with all requirements.
tasks: Review hackathon criteria, confirming file formats and sizes
Proofread all text, validate links and repos

name: Practice
info: "Rehearse until it feels like second nature."
moreInfo: Rehearse your presentation to deliver a clear and confident pitch
tasks: Time your full run-through by recording and reviewing yourself
Practice speaker transitions and plan for tech glitches
